segment.name: Beginning of message
segment.documentation: BGM, A segment by which the sender must uniquely identify the work grant request by means of its type and number and, when necessary, its function.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying general dates and, when relevant, times related to the whole message. The segment must be specified at least once to identify the document date. The Date/time/period segment within other Segment groups should be used whenever the date or time or period requires to be logically related to another specified data item.

segment.name: Quantity
segment.documentation: QTY, A segment identifying the quantity of employees of an enterprise, divided into workers and remunerated staff and each group further divided into foreigners and natives.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 1: A group of segments identifying the parties with associated information.

segment.name: Party identification
segment.documentation: PNA, A segment identifying names of the parties, in coded or clear form, and their functions relevant to the Work Grant Request Message. Identification of the enterprise and the job administration parties is mandatory for the Work Grant Request Message. It is recommended that, where possible, only the coded form of the party identification should be specified, e.g. where the enterprise and the job administration are known to each other, thus only the coded identification is required, but a job center or a job application address (interview) may vary and would have to be clearly specified, preferably in structured format.

segment.name: Address
segment.documentation: ADR, A segment specifying the address of the relevant party.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, A segment giving more specific location information of the party specified in the ADR segment, e.g. internal site or building number.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the relevant date or time.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 2: A group of segments giving contact details of the specific person or department within the party identified in the PNA segment.

segment.name: Contact information
segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify a person or department and their function, to whom communications should be directed.

segment.name: Communication contact
segment.documentation: COM, A segment to identify a communications type and number for the contact specified in the CTA segment, e.g. telephone- number, fax-number, telex-number.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 3: A group of segments for giving references and, where necessary, their dates, relating to the whole message.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying the reference by its number related to the whole message.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the date or time related to the reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 4: A group of segments specifying general processing indicators and, when necessary, additional textual information, relevant for the whole message.

segment.name: Processing information
segment.documentation: GEI, A segment specifying general indicators for the whole message.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation:
FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, used when additional information is needed but cannot be accommodated within other segments. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.
4.1.2 Detail section
Information to be provided in the Detail section:

segment.name: Section control
segment.documentation: UNS, A mandatory service segment placed before the first user segment in the detail section to avoid segment collision.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 5: A group of segments providing details of the individual worker and information related to the work grant request. There must be at least one occurrence of Segment group 5 within a Work Grant Request Message. This Segment group may be repeated to give information about several other foreigners and work grant requests. The Segment group 5 gives information about the person, the profession, the location of the executed job and may give additional information of the job, the remuneration and, when necessary, the address of the related job center.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying the administrative operation of the work grant request by a number given by employment agency.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying date and, when relevant, time relating to the work grant request. Examples of the use of this DTM segment are: starting date of social insurance.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 6: A group of segments specifying identity and related information regarding a person expected to be employed.

segment.name: Party identification
segment.documentation: PNA, A segment giving the identity, in coded and/or clear form, of the person expected to be employed.

segment.name: Address
segment.documentation: ADR, A segment identifying the address of a person and its function relevant to the Work grant request message.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment indicating the date of birth of the person concerned by the work grant or permit.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, A segment giving more specific location information of the party specified in the ADR segment, e.g. administrative location of a person.

segment.name: Nationality
segment.documentation: NAT, A segment indicating nationality of the person expected to be employed.

segment.name: Person demographic information
segment.documentation: PDI, A segment indicating some addition information relating to the person expected for an employment i.e. gender, marital status...

segment.name: Document/message details
segment.documentation: DOC, A segment giving the list of documents the person may produce.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment giving, in coded or free format, any additional information regarding the identity and status of the person: i.e. new national administrative requirements not yet solved by the message.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 7: A group of segments specifying general processing indicators and, when necessary, additional textual information, relevant for a work grant request.

segment.name: Processing information
segment.documentation: GEI, A segment specifying general indicators related to a work grant request, e.g. indicator for a new work grant request, indicator for an extension of an existing work grant request.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, used when additional information is needed but cannot be accommodated within other segments. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 8: A group of segments for giving references and, where necessary, their dates, relevant to a work grant request.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment for specifying references relevant to a work grant request, e.g. social insurance number of the foreigner.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the date or time related to the reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 9: A group of segments identifying the profession for a job and attributes, such as education and experience for this job.

segment.name: Employment details
segment.documentation: EMP, A segment to identify the related area or sector of a qualification and the qualification, in coded or clear form, related to a job.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, A segment indicating the location, where the job should be performed regarding work grant request.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 10: A group of segments giving coded information about the requirements of a profession or job regarding educational qualifications and experience and, when necessary, additional textual information.

segment.name: Attribute
segment.documentation: ATT, A segment identifying the attributes of a job or profession. The codes are related to education, job experience, special knowledge and required qualifications.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, used when additional information is needed but cannot be accommodated within other segments. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 11: A group of segments giving information about the type of the remuneration and the basic conditions of the remuneration. It may contain the remuneration amount or a remuneration range and additional remuneration benefits.

segment.name: Remuneration type identification
segment.documentation: SAL, A segment identifying the type of the remuneration and, if required, the name of the remuneration type or contract.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information for the remuneration type or contract, in coded or clear form, used when additional information is needed but cannot be accommodated within other segments. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the dates and/or times related to the remuneration.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 12: A group of segments giving attribute information, in coded form, for the remuneration and, where necessary, additional textual information.

segment.name: Attribute
segment.documentation: ATT, A segment identifying in coded form additional remuneration information and other benefits. The codes are related working conditions, working time, employment contract, piece of work and remuneration benefits.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information for additional remuneration benefits, in coded or clear form, used when additional information is needed but cannot be accommodated within other segments. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 13: A group of segments specifying general processing indicators and, when necessary, additional textual information, relevant for the remuneration.

segment.name: Processing information
segment.documentation: GEI, A segment specifying general indicators related to the remuneration.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, used when additional information is needed but cannot be accommodated within other segments. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 14: A group of segments specifying the type and the amount of the remuneration or a remuneration range.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, A segment giving information about the type and the amount of the remuneration.

segment.name: Range details
segment.documentation: RNG, A segment to identify a remuneration range, when an exact remuneration amount in the MOA segment is not available. The remuneration range is related to the type of remuneration in the MOA segment.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, used when additional information is needed but cannot be accommodated within other segments. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 15: A group of segments identifying the parties involved with the work grant request with associated information.

segment.name: Party identification
segment.documentation: PNA, A segment identifying names of the parties, in coded or clear form, and their functions relevant to the work grant request, e.g. a related job center involved with the work grant request. It is recommended that, where possible, only the coded form of the party identification should be specified, e.g. where the enterprise and the job administration are known to each other, only the coded identification is required, but a job center or a job application or interview address may vary and would have to be clearly specified, preferably in structured format.

segment.name: Address
segment.documentation: ADR, A segment giving the address of the relevant party.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, A segment giving more specific location information of the party specified in the ADR segment, e.g. internal site or building number.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment specifying the date or time related to the party given in the PNA segment.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment with free text information, in coded or clear form, used when additional information is needed but cannot be accommodated within other segments. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 16: A group of segments giving contact details of the specific person or department within the party identified in the PNA segment, e.g. person in the job center department.

segment.name: Contact information
segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify a person or department and their function, to whom communications should be directed.

segment.name: Communication contact
segment.documentation: COM, A segment to identify a communications type and number for the contact specified in the CTA segment, e.g. telephone- number, fax-number, telex-number.
